graph Class

Defined in: lib/api/graph.js:13
Module: graph
Parent Module: arango

The api module to perform graph related operations on ArangoDB.

  • Methods

  • edges
  • waitForSync
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:25

creates a Graph.

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • vertices String
    • the vertices collection
  • edges String
    • the edge collection
  • waitForSync Object
    • boolean , wait until document has been sync to disk.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

edge.create

(
  • graph
  • edgeData
  • from
  • to
  • label
  • [waitForSync=false]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:227

creates an edge within a Graph

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • edgeData Object
    • the vertex object as JSON. It is possible to set the vertex key by providing the _key attribute.
  • from String
    • the start vertex of this edge
  • to String
    • the end vertex of this edge
  • label String
    • the edges label
  • [waitForSync=false] Boolean optional
    • wait until document has been sync to disk.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

edge.delete

(
  • graph
  • id
  • [options.match]
  • [options.rev]
  • [options.forceUpdate]
  • [options.waitForSync=false]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:351

Deletes an edge

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • id String
    • the edge-handle
  • [options.match] Boolean optional
    • defining if the given revision should match the found document or not.
  • [options.rev] Number optional
    • The revision, used by the "match" attribute.
  • [options.forceUpdate] Boolean optional
    • If set an update is performed even when the given revision does not match.
  • [options.waitForSync=false] Boolean optional
    • Wait until document has been synced to disk.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

(
  • graph
  • id
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:264

retrieves an edge from a graph

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • id String
    • the edge-handle
  • [options] Object optional
    • an object with the following optional parameters:
    • [match] Boolean optional
      • defining if the given revision should match the found document or not.
    • [rev] Number optional
      • The revision, used by the "match" attribute.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

edge.patch

(
  • graph
  • id
  • data
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:319

patches an edge with the data given in data

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • id String
    • the edge-handle
  • data Object
    • the data of the edge as JSON object
  • [options] Object optional
    • an object with the following optional parameters:
    • [match] Boolean optional
      • defining if the given revision should match the found document or not.
    • [rev] Number optional
      • The revision, used by the "match" attribute.
    • [forceUpdate] Boolean optional
      • If set an update is performed even when the given revision does not match.
    • [waitForSync=false] Boolean optional
      • Wait until document has been synced to disk.
    • [keepNull=true] Boolean optional
      • if set to false a patch request will delete every null value
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

edge.put

(
  • graph
  • id
  • data
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:287

replaces an edge with the data given in data.

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • id String
    • the vertex-handle
  • data Object
    • the data of the edge as JSON object
  • [options] Object optional
    • an object with the following optional parameters:
    • [match] Boolean optional
      • defining if the given revision should match the found document or not.
    • [rev] Number optional
      • The revision, used by the "match" attribute.
    • [forceUpdate] Boolean optional
      • If set an update is performed even when the given revision does not match.
    • [waitForSync=false] Boolean optional
      • Wait until document has been synced to disk.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

edges

(
  • graph
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:465

returns all edges of a graph.

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph.
  • [options] Object optional
    • the following optional parameters are allowed:
    • [batchSize] Number optional
      • the batch size of the returned cursor.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • limit the result size.
    • [count=false] Boolean optional
      • return the total number of results.
    • [filter] Object optional
      • a optional filter, The attributes of filter:
      • [labels] List optional
        - filter by an array of edge labels (empty array means no restriction)
      • [properties] Object optional
        - filter neighbors by an array of edge properties, The attributes of a property filter:
      • [key] String optional
        - filter the result vertices by a key value pair
      • [value] String optional
        - the value of the key
      • [compare] String optional
        - a compare operator
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

(
  • graph
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:51

retrieves a graph from the database

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

getEdgesForVertex

(
  • graph
  • vertex
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:409

returns all neighbouring edges of the given vertex .

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • vertex String
    • the vertex
  • [options] Object optional
    • the following optional parameters are allowed:
    • [batchSize] Number optional
      • the batch size of the returned cursor.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • limit the result size.
    • [count=false] Boolean optional
      • return the total number of results.
    • [filter] Object optional
      • a optional filter, The attributes of filter:
      • [labels] List optional
        - filter by an array of edge labels (empty array means no restriction)
      • [properties] Object optional
        - filter neighbors by an array of edge properties, The attributes of a property filter:
      • [key] String optional
        - filter the result vertices by a key value pair
      • [value] String optional
        - the value of the key
      • [compare] String optional
        - a compare operator
    • [direction=any] String optional

      filter for inbound (value "in") or outbound (value "out") neighbors.

  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

getNeighbourVertices

(
  • graph
  • vertex
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:378

returns all neighbouring vertices of the given vertex .

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • vertex String
    • the vertex
  • [options] Object optional
    • the following optional parameters are allowed:
    • [batchSize] Number optional
      • the batch size of the returned cursor.
    • [limit] Number optional
      • limit the result size.
    • [count=false] Boolean optional
      • return the total number of results.
    • [filter] Object optional
      • a optional filter, The attributes of filter:
      • [labels] List optional
        - filter by an array of edge labels (empty array means no restriction)
      • [properties] Object optional
        - filter neighbors by an array of edge properties, The attributes of a property filter:
      • [key] String optional
        - filter the result vertices by a key value pair
      • [value] String optional
        - the value of the key
      • [compare] String optional
        - a compare operator
    • [direction=any] String optional

      filter for inbound (value "in") or outbound (value "out") neighbors.

  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

  • val
)
Object

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:492

Object:
  • The modified instance of the graph module.

vertex.delete

(
  • graph
  • id
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:197

Deletes a vertex

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • id String
    • the vertex-handle
  • [options] Object optional
    • an object with the following optional parameters:
    • [match] Boolean optional
      • defining if the given revision should match the found document or not.
    • [rev] Number optional
      • The revision, used by the "match" attribute.
    • [waitForSync] Number optional
      • Boolean, wait until document has been synced to disk.
    • [forceUpdate] Boolean optional
      • If set an update is performed even when the given revision does not match.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

vertex.patch

(
  • graph
  • id
  • data
  • [options]
  • callback
)
Promise

Defined in lib/api/graph.js:165

patches a vertex with the data given in data

Parameters:

  • graph String
    • the name of the graph
  • id String
    • the vertex-handle
  • data Object
    • the data of the vertex as JSON object
  • [options] Object optional
    • an object with the following optional parameters:
    • [match] Boolean optional
      • defining if the given revision should match the found document or not.
    • [rev] Number optional
      • The revision, used by the "match" attribute.
    • [forceUpdate] Boolean optional
      • If set an update is performed even when the given revision does not match.
    • [waitForSync=false] Boolean optional
      • Wait until document has been synced to disk.
    • [keepNull=true] Boolean optional
      • if set to false a patch request will delete every null value
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.

Returns:

Promise:

      • defining if the given revision should match the found document or not.
    • [rev] Number optional
      • The revision, used by the "match" attribute.
    • [forceUpdate] Boolean optional
      • If set an update is performed even when the given revision does not match.
    • [waitForSync=false] Boolean optional
      • Wait until document has been synced to disk.
  • callback Function
    • The callback function.
